docs.summary: Manages scheduable resources (e.g. Staff Member, Rooms)

params.name: schedules
params.doc:
List of schedules to be assigned for the created resource. Currently only a single schedule is allowed.
 If provided, any schedules in the resource entity will be ignored.

docs.summary:
Creates a resource.
<!--ONLY:VELO The `createResource()` function returns a promise that resolved to a resource object when a resource is created.<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->
 Resources are created with a schedule. The schedule and its sessions determine the resource's availability. If the resource is available during the business's default hours, the business's schedule is added as a linked schedule in the resource's schedule. If the resource has its own custom hours, a schedule must be created with recurring sessions. Set these sessions to type `"AVAILABILITY"`. Recurring sessions are used to define resource availability. Do not use availability constraints for resource schedules. 
 <!--ONLY:VELO The sequence for creating a resource is as follows:
 1. Create the resource using `createResource()` including schedule information. If the resource uses the default business hours, get the business resource's schedule ID  and include it in the linkedSchedules array in the availability object in the schedule parameters.
 1. If the resource has its own schedule, create recurring sessions of type `AVAILABILITY` using `createSession()` with the `scheduleId` returned from `createResource()`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

extra.description: Creates a resource with its working hours.

examples.title: Create Resource

extra.description: Creates a resource with its working hours.

examples.title: Create Resource

extra.description: Creates a resource with business working hours.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the resource to delete.

docs.summary:
Deletes a resource.
<!--ONLY:VELO The `deleteResource()` function returns a promise that resolved when a resource is deleted.<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->
Deleting a resource cancels its schedule and associated sessions.

params.name: query.fields
params.doc: Projection on the result object - list of specific field names to return. If fieldsets are also specified, return the union of fieldsets and fields

params.name: query.fieldsets
params.doc: Projection on the result object - list of named projections. E.g. "basic" will return id and name fields. Specifying multiple fieldsets will return the union of fields from all. Specifying fieldsets and fields will also return the union of fields.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of the business resources according to the provided filters and paging.
 This query is optional. If no query is provided than all non-deleted resources are returned.
  
 |Property|Is supported|
 |--|--|
 |filter | supports `resource.id`, `resource.tag`, `resource.status`| 
 |paging | supported |
 |fields | supported | 
 |paging | not supported |  
 |fields | not supported | 
 |fieldsets | not supported |

> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar, Read Bookings - Public Data, Read Bookings - Including Participants or Manage Bookings permission scope.

examples.title: List Resources

extra.description: Lists all resources in the site.

examples.title: List Resources by tags

extra.description: Lists all the resources with the tag "staff"

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of the business resources according to the provided filters and paging.
 This query is optional. If no query is provided than all non-deleted resources are returned.

 |Property|Is supported|
 |--|--|
 |filter | supports `resource.id`, `resource.tag`, `resource.status`| 
 |paging | supported |
 |fields | supported | 
 |paging | not supported |  
 |fields | not supported | 
 |fieldsets | not supported |

> **Permissions**
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar, Read Bookings - Public Data, Read Bookings - Including Participants or Manage Bookings permission scope.

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

params.name: scheduleActions
params.doc:
Actions to perform on the resources schedules. Can contain schedules to create, update, and cancel.
 Either the 'schedules' or 'schedule_actions' should be specified but not both. If both are provided, the schedules in the resource entity is ignored.

docs.summary: Updates a resource. This can be used also to update the resource's schedules.

extra.description: Updates a resource with its schedule.

permissions.name: Read Bookings Calendar
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's bookings calendar info, including all sessions, scheduleable assets, and staff member data.

permissions.name: Read Bookings - Public Data
permissions.description: Request permission to read the business's bookings info, including staff member data (calendar, services, etc.)

members.name: id
members.doc: WixMedia image ID.

members.name: url
members.doc: Image URL.

members.name: height
members.doc: Original image height.

members.name: width
members.doc: Original image width.

members.name: altText
members.doc: Image alt text. Optional.

members.name: amount
members.doc: The required payment amount.

members.name: currency
members.doc: The currency in which the amount is quoted.

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: The amount of a down payment or deposit as part of the transaction.

messages.name: labeledPriceOptionsMapEntry
messages.displayName: labeled Price Options Map Entry Object

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.

members.name: priceText
members.doc: Textual price information used when **Price Per Session** is set to **Custom Price** in the app's service details page.

docs.summary:
Time periods that this location is open for business. Includes a collection of TimePeriod instances.
Aligned with https://developers.google.com/my-business/reference/rest/v4/accounts.locations#businesshours
With a few minor adjustments

members.name: periods
members.doc:
Times that this location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours.

docs.summary:
A span of time that the business is open,
starting on the specified open day/time and closing on the specified close day/time.
Closing time must occur after the opening time, for example later in the same day, or on a subsequent day.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

docs.summary: Set of time periods when a location's operational hours differ from its normal business hours.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: endDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the location

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name of the location

members.name: description
members.doc: Free text to better describe the location

members.name: default
members.doc:
Boolean that states the default location.
There can one default location per site, and changes on it affect on the Site Properties.
The default location can't be deleted and can be only marked through SetDefaultLocation api

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the location. Active by default

members.name: locationType
members.doc: Type of the location

members.name: fax
members.doc: Fax number

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: Time zone

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number

members.name: address
members.doc: Address

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Represents the time periods that this location is open for business. Holds a collection of TimePeriod instances.
TimePeriod indicates when the location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Location revision, represent the number of changes on the location

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Boolean that states if the location is archived.
Archived location can't be updated.

members.name: country
members.doc: country code

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: subdivision (usually state or region) code according to ISO 3166-2

members.name: city
members.doc: city name

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: zip/postal code

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: A break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the human-readable address of this location

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text for human-to-human textual orientation aid purposes

members.name: geocode
members.doc: coordinates of the physical address

docs.summary: Address Geolocation

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude

members.name: country
members.doc: Country code.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Zip/postal code.

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the full address of this location.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text to help find the address.

members.name: geocode
members.doc: Coordinates of the physical address.

members.name: countryFullname
members.doc: Country full name.

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: Multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name
members.doc: Subdivision full name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Address latitude.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address longitude.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
+ `OWNER_BUSINESS` The business address as set in the sites general settings.
 + `OWNER_CUSTOM` The address as set when creating the service.
 + `CUSTOM` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: address
members.doc: Free text address used when location_type is `OWNER_CUSTOM`.

members.name: customAddress
members.doc: Custom address, used when location_type is `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: transparency
members.doc:
Sets a linked schedule's availability between the start and end of the session. Default is `"BUSY"`.
If set to `"BUSY"`, the schedule cannot have any available slots during the session. If set to `"FREE"`, the schedule can have available slots during the session.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID, of the linked schedule.

docs.summary: The time between available slots' start times. For example, For 5 minute slots, 3:00, 3:05, 3:15 etc. For 1 hour slots, 3:00, 4:00, 5:00 etc.

members.name: sameAsDuration
members.doc:
Whether the slot duration is used as the split interval value.
If `same_as_duration` is `true`, the `value_in_minutes` is the sum of the first duration in
`schedule.availabilityConstraints.SlotDurations` field, and `schedule.availabilityConstraints.TimeBetweenSlots` field.

members.name: valueInMinutes
members.doc: Number of minutes between available slots' start times when `same_as_duration` is `false`.

docs.summary:
<!-- Needs updating when recurrence has been tested 
Schedule's availability calculation is executed by the schedule's available intervals and this additional information.
Schedule's available intervals are recurring intervals (defined in the schedule) minus sessions that has no more spots for bookings (including time between_slots), or schedule's sessions with open spots for bookings.-->

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the schedule starts to be available for booking. For example, a schedule can become available at a future date.

members.name: end
members.doc: Date and time the schedule stops being available for booking. No value indicates no end time.

members.name: linkedSchedules
members.doc: Other schedules that impact the availability calculation. Relevant only when there are availability constraints.

members.name: constraints
members.doc: Constraints for calculating the schedule's availability.

docs.summary: Describes how to calculate the specific slots that are available for booking.

members.name: slotDurations
members.doc:
A list of duration options for slots, in minutes. Minimum value for a duration is 1.
The availability calculation generates slots with these durations, where there is no conflict with existing sessions or other availability constraints.

members.name: timeBetweenSlots
members.doc:
The number of minutes between the `end` of one slot, and the `start` of the next. 
Minimum value is 0, maximum value is 120.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc:
Specify how to split the slots in intervals of minutes.
This value indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).
Optional. The default is the first duration in slot_durations field.
Deprecated. Use the `split_slots_interval.value_in_minutes`.

members.name: slotsSplitInterval
members.doc: An object defining the time between available slots' start times.  For example, a slot with slots_split_interval=5 can start every 5 minutes. The default is the slot duration.

members.name: title
members.doc: Synced title of the external calendar event.

members.name: description
members.doc: Synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: repetition
members.doc: The frequency of the recurrence in weeks. i.e. when this value is 4, the interval occurs every 4 weeks. Optional. The default is 1. minimum: 1, maximum: 52.

members.name: daysOfWeek
members.doc: The day the interval accrue. Optional. The default is the day of the recurring interval's start time.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: The hour of the day the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval start time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 23.

members.name: minuteOfHour
members.doc: The minutes of hour the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval end time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 59.

members.name: duration
members.doc: The duration of the interval in minutes. Required. Part of the session end time calculation. minimum: 1, maximum: 86400.

members.name: id
members.doc: The recurring interval identifier.

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the recurring interval. Required.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the recurring interval. Optional. Empty value indicates that there is no end time.

members.name: interval
members.doc: The interval rules. The day, hour and minutes the interval is recurring.

members.name: frequency
members.doc: The frequency of the interval. Optional. The default is frequency with the default repetition.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc: Specifies the list of linked schedules and the way this link affects the corresponding schedules' availability. Can be calculated from the schedule or overridden on the recurring interval.

members.name: intervalType
members.doc: The type of recurring interval.

members.name: id
members.doc: Participant ID.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Participant's name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Participant's phone number.

members.name: email
members.doc: Participant's email address.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Group or party size. The number of people attending. Defaults to 0. Maximum is 250.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc: Approval status for the participant. Generally the same status as the booking, unless updated using the `updateParticipant` API. Defaults to `"UNDEFINED"`.

members.name: inherited
members.doc: Whether the participant was inherited from the schedule, as opposed to being booked directly to the session.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conferencing provider ID

members.name: id
members.doc: Wix Calendar conference ID.

members.name: externalId
members.doc: Conference meeting ID in the provider's conferencing system.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conference provider ID.

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference.

members.name: password
members.doc: Password to join the conference.

members.name: description
members.doc: Conference description.

members.name: conferenceType
members.doc: Conference type.

members.name: accountOwnerId
members.doc: Account owner id in vc service

members.name: id
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the schedule's owner entity. This may be a resource ID, a session ID, or a service ID.

members.name: intervals
members.doc:
Specifies the intervals for the sessions calculation. Optional. e.g. when creating class service you can add
pattern for recurring intervals, these intervals can be returned as schedule's sessions or available slots if
there are no other availability calculation constraints and the capacity is bigger then the current total number of sessions' participants.

members.name: title
members.doc: Default title for the schedule's sessions. Maximum length: 6000 characters.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for grouping schedules. These tags are the default tags for the schedule's sessions.
The Wix Bookings app uses the following predefined tags: `INDIVIDUAL`, `GROUP`, and `COURSE`. However, you can use your own tags if you're not using the app.

members.name: location
members.doc: Default location for the schedule's sessions.

members.name: capacity
members.doc: Maximum number of participants that can be added to the schedule's sessions. Default is 1.

members.name: rate
members.doc: Price options offered when booking this schedule's slots. Default is no rate.

members.name: availability
members.doc:
An object describing how to calculate the schedule's availability.
An empty object indicates that the schedule is not available for booking.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants registered to sessions in this schedule, calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
Participants currently registered to sessions in this schedule.
Participants who are registered in the schedule are automatically registered to any session that is created for the schedule.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).

members.name: status
members.doc: Schedule status.

members.name: created
members.doc: Schedule creation date.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Schedule last update date.

members.name: version
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc: Fields which were inherited from the Business Info page under Settings in the Dashboard.

members.name: conferenceProvider
members.doc: Conferencing Provider. A schedule with a conferencing provider will use to provider information to create a conference on the provider's system when a session is created on the schedule or on one of its linked schedule's.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc: A conference created for the schedule. This is used when a participant is added to a schedule.

members.name: id
members.doc: Resource unique ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Resource name.

members.name: email
members.doc: Resource email address.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Resource phone number.

members.name: description
members.doc: Resource description.

members.name: tag
members.doc: Deprecated - use tags instead.

members.name: tags
members.doc: Resource tags. These are used to identify, group, and filter the different type of resources. For example, 'staff' or 'room'.

members.name: images
members.doc: Resource images.

members.name: schedules
members.doc: List of the schedules owned by this resource. Min size 1.

members.name: scheduleIds
members.doc: List of the schedule IDs of the schedules that are owned by this resource.

members.name: status
members.doc: Resource status. Read only. Default is `CREATED`.

members.name: resource
members.doc: Updated resource entity.

members.name: event
members.doc: Event type.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load

members.name: offset
members.doc: number of items to skip in the current sort order

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load

members.name: cursor
members.doc: Cursor returned in last query response. Should not be provided on first page request

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used and 'too_many_to_count' flag is not set

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: A flag that indicates the server failed to calculate 'total' field

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next result page

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous result page

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order (ASC/DESC). Defaults to ASC

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.name: paging
members.doc: Limit number of results

members.name: fields
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of specific field names to return. If fieldsets are also specified, return the union of fieldsets and fields

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of named projections. E.g. "basic" will return id and name fields. Specifying multiple fieldsets will return the union of fields from all. Specifying fieldsets and fields will also return the union of fields.

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.name: fields
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of specific field names to return. If fieldsets are also specified, return the union of fieldsets and fields

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Projection on the result object - list of named projections. E.g. "basic" will return id and name fields. Specifying multiple fieldsets will return the union of fields from all. Specifying fieldsets and fields will also return the union of fields.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Can not be used together with 'cursorPaging'

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Can't be used together with 'paging'. 'cursorPaging.cursor' can not be used together with 'filter' or 'sort'

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change.

members.name: message
members.doc: A custom message to send to the participants.

docs.summary: schedule

members.name: schedule
members.doc: Schedule.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: Schedule.

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

members.name: alignTimeExceptions
members.doc: Optional. Defaults to false. In case of updated intervals' start time, this field indicates whether to align those interval's time exceptions.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Deprecated, use participant_notification.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

members.name: createRequests
members.doc: Create multiple schedules.

members.name: updateRequests
members.doc: Update multiple schedules. Not Supported yet.

members.name: cancelRequests
members.doc:
Cancel multiple schedules.
The given schedules move to a CANCELLED status which means that all sessions up until
the cancellation point in time are kept, while removing all following sessions.

members.name: created
members.doc: Created schedules.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Updated schedules.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc: Cancelled schedules.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: from
members.doc: Time to cancel the sessions from. Optional. If this field is empty, all of this schedule's sessions will be canceled.

members.name: preserveFutureSessionsWithParticipants
members.doc: Whether to preserve future sessions with reservations. Defaults to false.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

members.name: ids
members.doc: List of resource IDs to delete.

members.name: resources
members.doc: List of resource entities to create.

members.name: batchedResources
members.doc: Optional. If provided, the resources field is ignored.

members.doc: List of the created resources.

members.name: schedules

List of schedules to be assigned for the created resource. Currently only a single schedule is allowed.
 If provided, any schedules in the resource entity will be ignored.

members.doc: The created resource.

members.doc: ID of the resource to delete.

members.name: id
members.doc: Deleted resource id

members.name: resource
members.doc: The updated resource.

members.name: fieldMask
members.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

members.name: scheduleActions
members.doc:
Actions to perform on the resources schedules. Can contain schedules to create, update, and cancel.
 Either the 'schedules' or 'schedule_actions' should be specified but not both. If both are provided, the schedules in the resource entity is ignored.

members.name: resource
members.doc: Updated Resource

members.name: resources

members.name: resources

docs.summary:
Enumerates the days of the week. Possible values are:
  • MONDAY
  • TUESDAY
  • WEDNESDAY
  • THURSDAY
  • FRIDAY
  • SATURDAY
  • SUNDAY

For future use Possible values are:
  • ACTIVE
  • IN_ACTIVE

For future use Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • BRANCH
  • OFFICES
  • RECEPTION
  • HEADQUARTERS

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OWNER_BUSINESS
  • OWNER_CUSTOM
  • CUSTOM

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • FREE - The schedule can have available slots during the session.
  • BUSY - The schedule cannot have available slots during the session. Default value.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Undefined.
  • MON - Monday.
  • TUE - Tuesday.
  • WED - Wednesday.
  • THU - Thursday.
  • FRI - Friday.
  • SAT - Saturday.
  • SUN - Sunday.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - The default value. Sessions for this interval will be of type EVENT.
  • EVENT - A recurring interval of events
  • TIME_AVAILABILITY - Deprecated
  • AVAILABILITY - A recurring interval for availability

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Default.
  • PENDING - Pending business approval.
  • APPROVED - Approved by the business.
  • DECLINED - Declined by the business.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • ONLINE_MEETING_PROVIDER - API-generated online meeting.
  • CUSTOM - User-defined meeting.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CREATED - The default value when the schedule is created.
  • CANCELLED - The schedule has been cancelled.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CREATED
  • DELETED
  • UPDATED

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • Updated
  • Deleted
  • Created

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC
